pr_title: NMS-12794: Add support for metadata for threshold fields

timeline.message: NMS-12794: Add support for metadata for threshold fields
NMS-12794: Add support for metadata for threshold fields

timeline.bodyText: null and "" are already covered cases by parseInt() and parseDouble(). Is there a specific reason to add this additional check?
timeline.author: mattixtech

replies.bodyText: parseDouble doesn't have a null check besides it also saves going through that exception.
replies.author: cgorantla

replies.bodyText: Oh yeah, you are right, parseDouble only handles the empty case and not the null. Weird inconsistency in the stdlib!
replies.author: mattixtech

timeline.bodyText: Do we need this cached field? It looks like the presence or absence of a value in thresholdValues would be sufficient.
timeline.author: mattixtech

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, this is needed since thresholdValues can exist before and after reload.
Doesn't state itself get reset when reloading ? Looks like it's not. When merging thresholds it retains previous ThresholdStates and just loads the config again.  There are several tests with  ThresholdingVisitor  reload that mimics this  behavior.
replies.author: cgorantla

replies.bodyText: Not sure I follow, looks like very writer of thresholdValues also sets the cached field. Also upon deserializing an object with thresholdValues set wouldn't cached also be set in that case?
replies.author: mattixtech

replies.bodyText: clearStateBeforePersist unsets the cache which gets called in ThresholdingVisitor reload.  If you are saying that thresholdValues can be set as null or Optional.empty in clearStateBeforePersist that's an option but I chose this as this is common to both interpolatedExpression and thresholdValues.
replies.author: cgorantla

replies.bodyText: Ok, I missed the part where it was getting cleared in clearStateBeforePersist, I was thinking it was always being set in a tandem with the value. No worries, can leave as is.
replies.author: mattixtech

timeline.author: mattixtech

timeline.bodyText: Why does this method take a consumer? It looks like it would be sufficient to simply return the values and take no parameters here.
timeline.author: mattixtech

timeline.bodyText: The interface name here is misleading as this seems to be supplying rather than consuming.
timeline.author: mattixtech

timeline.bodyText: Looks like this doesn't need to accept a consumer either. The caller should be able to use the return value.
timeline.author: mattixtech

timeline.bodyText:
Since we are already using Optional in this class in some places to signify the absence of a value can we use that for the new/refactored methods rather than returning null.
This applies for the rest of new code in this class as well where nullable values are being returned.
Also the javadoc should either be updated or deleted as these methods don't return primitives anymore and the javadoc does not indicate when they would return null (or if we update them optional).
timeline.author: mattixtech

replies.bodyText: Updated javadocs.  The places this is getting called seems better without Optional
replies.author: cgorantla

timeline.bodyText: Looks like we don't need to churn this file.
timeline.author: mattixtech

timeline.bodyText: Since this method and isRearmExceeded will NPE if given nulls can we update the method signature to take a primitive. That way their preconditions will be enforced.
timeline.author: mattixtech

replies.bodyText: Doesn't look like this changed, anyways not a big deal...
replies.author: mattixtech

replies.bodyText: Oh, yeah. method with only one argument is only used in tests so added @VisibleForTesting annotation and other will always pre-check for null so this seems safe.
replies.author: cgorantla

replies.bodyText:
Not that it matters at this point, but the reason I originally commented on this is because the method would assert its preconditions by using a primitive double in the signature rather than implicitly only being valid with a non-null Double.
If we had changed the other code to return OptionalDouble rather than a nullable Double we would have either empty or a primitive double to pass in and we would satisfy the preconditions.
No need to action this, just explaining my train of thought.
replies.author: mattixtech
